title: [NEW] Having issues Patching 5.20? Click Here!
body:
Hey all!

World's is in full force, and we have some pretty nifty new features in the client/in-game!  We don't want any patching issues getting in the way of everyone [repping their favorite team](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KLB_KVu8xec).  If you are experiencing any issues, make sure to complete the following steps!

-----------------------------------------

> ***Why is the patcher playing random Audio Clips and causing me to go deaf?***

We aren't sure either!  We escalated this issue to our Patcher Team and we are hoping to get this resolved in the near future.  Thanks for all of the reports!

> ***Files Scanned reaches over 9000!!!!! Or, 15k, 20k, etc***

The patcher needs to scanned already installed files to make sure that none of the files are corrupt.  If it finds one, it replaces it and rescans the files.  This is why it can sometimes get as high as 20k, even though there aren't 20k files in the installation.  

**The best thing to do is let it scan files!**  If you restart the client, it may cause it to scan even more files.   The patcher will eventually stop scanning files, and it will patch normally afterward.

> ***Launcher/Patcher never pops up, or disappears after you press "LAUNCH"***

This can be caused by corruption with the patcher itself or it failed to properly self-patch. Additionally, it may be due to some issues with the configuration of your computer system's permissions (meaning it can't properly save the files in the correct location). To resolve this, make sure to complete all the steps in our [Patching Issues Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues)!


> ***Patcher stops/errors out at 33%, Patcher fails at 99%, or a general "Unspecified Error has occurred" message***

These are usually connection related errors. Either your computer is unable to maintain a stable connection, or a 3rd party security program is blocking League of Legends from properly patching. Many of the most common Anti-virus programs [have already whitelisted LoL](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq3), however make sure to update yours to the latest version!

Also, even though you may have set specific exceptions in place before for your security program, League of Legends has gone through a major update. Therefore, your security program may recognize the old version of League of Legends, but not the new version. 

To get these issues resolved ASAP, make sure to go through our [Connection Issues Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)!

--------------------------------------------------------------

*If after completing these steps, and you still do not see the glorious orange 'LAUNCH' button, feel free to drop us a post in this thread!  Rioters as well as Wrenchmen volunteers will be on hand to respond and provide some additional help!*

replies.body: "attempting to reconnect" a few times each game for 10-15 seconds, internet is fine though so it's just the client/game. No firewall blocking it, no other possible issues, uninstalled and reinstalled and gone through each and every online solution for connection issues with league. much sad. :(

Not sure if it was the patch or not but as soon as I update, my fps dropped significantly and league isn't running nearly as well as it use to. Before the patch I was running on Medium-High settings at about 120 but for some reason, after the patch I'm only running it at about 50-60 for some reason.

I keep getting the error that says "Unspecified error has occurred."  I've tried deleting the "lol_patcher" and "lol_launcher" folders to fix the issues, like I saw other people had said that fixed their issues with no positive results.  I looked through the logs and the only error that I see is this: 

"000106.447|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|  ERROR| Riot::LoLLauncherLib::ThreadedPatcherWorker<struct Riot::LoLLauncherLib::UpdateResult>::HandleUpdate: c:/jenkins/workspace/rclient_releases_code_win32/code/solutions/riotrads/source/rads/lolpatcherlib/PatcherWorker.inl(69): Worker update failed (HRESULT=80004005, complete=yes)"

This seems to be the consistent error that I am receiving.  I have no idea what this means... I do not have a folder ANYWHERE on my computer that is called "Jenkins," so I think that Jenkins over at riot is having some issues that is preventing me from getting past the launcher.

It looks like there were a few more errors in there than I had seen before.  I'm going to paste the end of the most recent lolpatcher logs that I have:

"000115.828|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|  ERROR| Riot::RADS::Common::LocalFileSystem::CopyFileA: Error 0x80004005: The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process.

Hello ckviper, it looks like some of the problems you are having are related to some files still running while you are trying to update League of Legends. If you have not done so yet, can you try restarting your computer.

Once the computer is restarted, try running League of Legends as Administrator. You can do that by right-clicking on the League of Legends icon and selecting, "Run as administrator."

Let me know if you have any other questions.
i downloaded the 5.20 patch yesterday and today game wont open its just stuck at 33% and keep scanning files PLEASE SOMEONE HELP OLEASE IF U KNOW HOW DONT BE LAZY TO HELP ME PLEASE{{champion:131}}

Okay... Riot.. Please do something about this. I am at nearly 100k files scanning. If this is some sort of joke, its not funny. It's not a connection problm because I'm on google fiber. The fact that you need nearly 100K files for one game mode, a few fixes and a new champ is ridiculous. It really makes me want to stop playing league. It's done this before and I am getting sick of it. Fix this..** Now**.
Sincerely,
An angry season 2 player.

Completely understand where your frustration is coming from, and its warranted.  When the patcher starts scanning files, it is checking for any corruption within the installation.  If it finds any corruption, it replaces the file and continues scanning.  I have actually never seen it reach 100k before, and that might indicate a different issue altogether.

After leaving the patcher alone for a while, did it eventually patch normally?  Or are you still experiencing other errors?  Reply back and let us know!
When League Starts loading, I Hear A Bunch Of Random Audio Clips.?

When your patcher get stuck at 99% or at 55%, what exactly happens?  Does an error message pop up?  Or does it simply get stuck on a particular section?

With a bit more information, I should be able provide some further help.  Let us know!

Help please. -_-

Hello Draykonian, a lot of people get this problem because of a failed update to the patcher. Can you open File Explorer on you computer and head to the League of Legends projects folder. It is typically located at "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects." Delete the "lol_patcher" and "lol_launcher" folders and try running League of Legends again. You'll notice it will take longer to open the patcher, this is normal, it's redownloading.

Let me know if you have any questions, or if it doesn't work.
Ya, that fixed it! Thanks!
What did man ?
Delete the "lol_patcher" and "lol_launcher" folders and try running League of Legends again. You'll notice it will take longer to open the patcher, this is normal, it's redownloading.

Umm, I don't know if anyone else has this issue, but the patcher keeps repeating this obnoxiously loud sound of somebody recalling until the game gets fully updated. Just letting yall know, its really loud

Riot please help, I was playing a game yesterday, and now I really want to play the One for all mode, but because of the update I am not able to. Its always stuck at 33%, it was about 11k scanned files when I closed the launcher and re-started league, now it's 5k again and I don't know if it's going to work. + **I am a MAC user**. Please do something~~~~

Every time that the patcher downloads an update, it needs to check the integrity of the installation.  In order to do that, it needs to scan the installation, replace any necessary files, and re-scan.  Restarting the client may just cause it to take even more time as it has to restart the process of scanning files again.

Make sure to just let the patcher scan any and all files.  Once it is finishes (it will eventually finish), you should patch normally.

Hello guys, recently (a day or two ago) I started experiencing a weird "bug" described below: 
-my champion stops responding
-everything else (other champions, minions, timer etc.) don't seem to be affected by this, what is more I can normally chat with my teammates
-after a while where I'm extremely vulnerable to enemies the screen "attempting to reconnect" pops out (my net is working fine, I have constant ping so I doubt that my computer or my connection is the source of this problem, my network logs also seem completely standard to me, up to the point where it disconnects me) I'll provide these logs if needed.

I also tried submitting a request on the Riot Games Support site, but didn't got a real advice that would help me. (https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/17980353)
Is it just me, or is anyone else experiencing the same problem?
It's currently being discussed under https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/19111789 I hope I'll get some answers that will help me.

Had to reinstall the client after replacing hard drive. "General unspecified error" came up when updating files, but continued to update anyways. Instead of showing the remaining amount in MBs, it displayed "0 files scanned", but the loading bar kept moving and now its stuck at 99%. What's the problem here?
I don't understand why i have to go on the pbe and not on the normal game ? please help ??{{item:3070}}
